intro: Mosheovia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in the southern part of the continent. Mosheovia species are typically shrubs or subshrubs, with small, often hairy leaves adapted to conserve water. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
